item.description:
We've got a lot of new members in the group, so I thought I'd offer an introductory ATC workshop. (Longer-time members are invited to attend, play and share what they know, too.)

We will:

--Start with some ATC basics, including tips for working in this particular format and for making cards that last.

--Make our own blank cards from various materials (watercolor paper, cardstock, chipboard, etc.)

--Experiment with a variety of techniques for creating ATC backgrounds (usually the first step in making ATCs). 

After the workshop, you're welcome to stay at the Studio to play as long as you like.

You'll go home with plenty of blank cards and backgrounds for future projects--and probably some finished cards as well. I'll also provide handouts covering what we learned.

AMENITIES: Free parking. Table space and a chair. Access to some tools (paper cutter, heat gun, etc.). Access to a fridge, microwave, toaster oven, kitchen sink and restroom. Dinner in or out, if people are interested.

COST: $15 to help defray the Studio rental costs. Includes all supplies.

WHO MAY ATTEND: Any member of the NE ATC+ or Altered Art/Assemblage Meetups and their guests (18+ only, please).

HOW TO SIGN UP: These smaller sessions are often full with a waiting list. Reserve a place by RSVP-ing "yes" using Meetup's RSVP function. You may RSVP for a guest as well.

If your plans (or your guests' plans) change, PLEASE update your RSVP accordingly. Please do this right up to the start time of the event.

WHAT TO BRING: Supplies will be provided (included in your cost for attending). If you have favorite tools, you're welcome to bring them. But we have plenty of scissors, glue sticks, etc., available for your use. Even if you show up empty-handed, you'll be fine. I also suggest bringing water or something else to drink, and, if you like, a snack to share.

CANCELLATIONS: In the unlikely event that we need to cancel---or even if we're just getting a late start--we'll post a message on the Web site and e-mail everyone who's RSVP'd "yes." So to be on the safe side, please check the Web site and your inbox before departing for ArtStudio 360!
item.how_to_find_us: Off Route 16 near intersection with Route 126

group.name: New England Artist Trading Cards Plus (ATCs+) Meetup Group

item.name: ATCs: Basics, Backgrounds & Beyond
